channel.title: CVE Feed for Qualcomm, Inc. -- Snapdragon Mobile
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Qualcomm, Inc. -- Snapdragon Mobile

item.title: CVE-2016-10385|2024-08-06T03:21:51.424Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In all Qualcomm products with Android releases from CAF using the Linux kernel, a use-after-free vulnerability exists in IMS RCS.

item.title: CVE-2016-10461|2024-08-06T03:21:52.138Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9650, SD 650/52, SD 808, SD 810, SD 820, and SDX20, lack of proper bounds checking may lead to a buffer overread.

item.title: CVE-2016-10419|2024-08-06T03:21:51.559Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9640, MDM9645, MDM9650, MDM9655, SD 450, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 820, SD 835, SD 845, SD 850, and SDX20, when initializing scheduler object service request, an out of bounds access could occur due to uninitialized object number.

item.title: CVE-2016-10483|2024-08-06T03:21:52.131Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 410/12, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 808, and SD 810, improper input validation while processing SCM Command can lead to unauthorized memory access.

item.title: CVE-2016-10454|2024-08-06T03:21:52.148Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 425, SD 430, SD 450, and SD 625, in a QTEE API function, an array out-of-bounds index can occur.

item.title: CVE-2016-10442|2024-08-06T03:21:51.471Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9640, SDM630, MSM8976, MSM8937, SDM845, MSM8976, and MSM8952, when running module or kernel code with improper access control allowing writing to arbitrary regions of memory, the user may utilize this vector to alter module executable code.

item.title: CVE-2016-10411|2024-08-06T03:21:51.707Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 400, SD 410/12, SD 430, SD 450, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 800, SD 808, SD 810, SD 820, and SD 835, RTP daemon crashes and terminates VT call when UE receives RTCP unknown APP packet report which caused the parser to miss an end of RTCP packet length and go on forever looking for it, even going beyond the limits of the RTCP Packet length.

item.title: CVE-2016-10475|2024-08-06T03:21:52.120Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 400, SD 430, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 800, SD 808, SD 810, and SD 820, lack input validation may lead to a integer overflow that could potentially lead to a buffer overflow.

item.title: CVE-2016-10498|2024-08-06T03:21:52.135Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9635M, MDM9645, MDM9650, MDM9655, SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 400, SD 410/12, SD 425, SD 427, SD 430, SD 435, SD 450, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 810, SDM630, SDM636, SDM660, and Snapdragon_High_Med_2016, stopping of the DTR prematurely causes micro kernel to be stuck. This can be triggered with a timing change injectable in RACH procedure.

item.title: CVE-2016-10496|2024-08-06T03:21:52.137Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9635M, SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 410/12, SD 450, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 808, and SD 810, A NULL pointer dereference can occur during an SSL handshake.

item.title: CVE-2016-10460|2024-08-06T03:21:52.113Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 835, SD 845, and SD 850, vendor specific opcodes may not have any packet length validation leading to buffer over-reads.

item.title: CVE-2016-10458|2024-08-06T03:21:52.154Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 410/12, SD 425, SD 427, SD 430, SD 435, SD 450, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 808, SD 810, SD 820, SD 835, SD 845, SDM630, SDM636, SDM660, SDX20, and Snapdragon_High_Med_2016, the 'proper' solution for this will be to ensure that any users of qsee_log in the bootchain (before Linux boots) unallocate their buffers and clear the qsee_log pointer. Until support for that is implemented in TZ and the bootloader, enable tz_log to avoid potential scribbling. This solution will prevent the linux kernel memory corruption.

item.title: CVE-2016-10479|2024-08-06T03:21:52.158Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9607, MDM9615, MDM9635M, MDM9640, SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 400, SD 600, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 650/52, SD 800, SD 810, and SD 820, an arbitrary length value from an incoming message to QMI Proxy can lead to an out-of-bounds write in the stack variable message.

item.title: CVE-2016-10495|2024-08-06T03:21:52.164Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9635M, made changes to map the scan type value to an index value that is in range.

item.title: CVE-2016-10407|2024-08-06T03:21:51.468Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 400, SD 410/12, SD 430, SD 450, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 800, SD 808, SD 810, SD 820, and SD 835, an integer overflow leading to buffer overflow can occur during a VT call.

item.title: CVE-2016-10440|2024-08-06T03:21:51.429Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 425, SD 430, SD 450, SD 625, and SD 650/52, there is improper access control to a bus.

item.title: CVE-2016-10406|2024-08-06T03:21:51.404Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile MDM9650, SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 410/12, SD 430, SD 450, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 808, SD 810, SD 820, and SD 835, while printing debug message of a pointer in wlan_qmi_err_cb, the real kernel address will be printed regardless of the kptr_restrict system settings.

item.title: CVE-2016-10489|2024-08-06T03:21:52.149Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 400, lack of address argument validation in qsee_get_tz_app_name() may lead to an untrusted pointer dereference.

item.title: CVE-2016-10478|2024-08-06T03:21:52.124Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 617, incorrect size calculation in QCRIL SCWS processing have Integer overflow which will lead to a buffer overflow.

item.title: CVE-2016-10477|2024-08-06T03:21:52.243Z -- qualcomm%2C%20inc. -- snapdragon%20mobile
item.description: In Android before 2018-04-05 or earlier security patch level on Qualcomm Snapdragon Mobile SD 210/SD 212/SD 205, SD 400, SD 430, SD 615/16/SD 415, SD 617, SD 625, SD 650/52, SD 800, SD 808, SD 810, and SD 820, while processing smart card requests, a buffer overflow can occur.
